DataElement.preferredName: Routine Activity Need Personal Assistance Due To Impairment Or Health Problem Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether you need a personal assistance to help with routine activities due to impairment or health problems.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Routine Activity Need Personal Assistance Due To Impairment Or Health Problem
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure._The state of being active; any specific activity._Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior._Person; a human being._The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort._Caused by or resulting from._Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.:The state of being active; any specific activity.

Concepts.definition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredName: Need Person Assistance Due To Impairment Or Health Problem
Property.preferredDefinition: Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.:Person; a human being.:The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.:Caused by or resulting from.:Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Concepts.definition: Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you need a personal assistance to help with routine activities due to impairment or health problems?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you need a personal assistance to help with routine activities due to impairment or health problems?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Because of any impairment or health problems, do you need the help of other persons in handling routine needs, such as everyday household chores, doing necessary business, shopping, or getting around for other purposes?
